container-title: The classic edition of surviving Stoic texts was for long J. von Arnim, Stoicorum Veterum Fragmenta
note: SVF). It has been superseded by K. Hulser, Die Fragmente zur Dialektik der Stoiker (Stuttgart: Frommann-Holzboog, 1987). For Epicureanism the fundamental collection is H. Usener, Epicurea (Leipzig, 1887).
title: Hellenistic Philosophy (Chapter 2) Much of our information about these philosophers derives from later writers such as Cicero, Lucretius, and Sextus Empiricus, whose works have been published as Oxford Classical Texts or in the Loeb Classical Library. The most helpful collection of the extant fragments and of references in ancient authors is The Hellenistic Philosophers by A
One volume of this work gives translations of the principal sources, and another gives an annotated edition of the Greek and Latin texts
